ingredients: 2 1/2 tbsp caster sugar / superfine sugar (sub granulated / ordinary sugar)
4 tsp baking powder (if yours is old, check it's still good)
1 1/3 cup milk, full fat, slightly warmed (not piping hot)
150g / 11 tbsp unsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled (not piping hot)
instructions: Whisk dry – Place the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large mixing bowl. Whisk to mix.
Whisk in wet – Add milk, eggs, and vanilla. Whisk to combine. Add melted butter then whisk until lump-free. The batter should be pourable but thick – slightly thinner than pancakes.
Recommended resting – Cover then refrigerate overnight, or for at least 2 hours. Softer insides, better flavor. Else, proceed immediately with cooking.
Preheat a waffle maker. A non-stick one will not need oil, plus there is butter in the batter.

Cooking – Use a ladle to pour batter in to just cover the iron. Don't get greedy – it will leak out the sides! Cook until golden and crisp – my good waffle iron takes 3 1/2 minutes, my Kmart one takes 6 minutes.
Serving – Transfer onto plates and serve as you go, with desired toppings. Or, put on a rack and keep warm in a preheated 70°C/150°F oven while you continue cooking!

ingredients: 1/4 cup / 55g white sugar (caster / super fine is best but not essential)
1 3/4 cups / 435 ml cups milk (any type, any fat %)
instructions: Place flour, baking powder, sugar and salt in a bowl, whisk to combine.
Add egg, milk and vanilla. Whisk until lump free - no longer than 30 seconds.

Heat a non stick skillet - use medium heat if you have a strong stove, medium high if you have a weak one. Add a tiny bit of butter (about 1/2 tsp) and swirl to melt. Use paper towel to mostly wipe the butter off (this is the trick to avoid a dodgy 1st pancake).
Pour 1/4 cup batter into the middle of the fry pan (I use a slightly heaped ice cream scoop with lever, standard is 1/4 cup).
Swirl pan lightly to spread or use the ice cream scoop edge to spread into 11cm / 4.5" circle (ruler is a must) (joking!).
When bubbles rise to the surface (see video), flip and cook the other side until golden.
Remove and keep warm in a low oven.
Use more butter every 2 to 3 pancakes - depends how good your non stick coating is.
Serve with toppings of choice!
Mix sausage pattie ingredients, form into 8 patties.
Cook in hot oil for 2 minutes per side until golden.
Serve with ketchup.
Preheat oven to 180C. Grease and line a square cake pan.
Melt butter and chocolate, then stir in remaining ingredients.
Pour into pan and bake for 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Easy Banana Cake Recipe
instructions: Preheat oven to 180C. Prepare loaf pan.
Mix all ingredients, pour into pan, and bake for 30-35 minutes.

recipes.name: Sticky Date Pudding
instructions: Preheat oven to 180C. Prepare cake pan.
Combine dates and bicarbonate of soda with boiling water, then cool.
Mix remaining ingredients, bake for 35-40 minutes.
Prepare sauce and pour over warm pudding.

recipes.name: Seven Colours Factory
ingredients: For the Pap: 1.5L water, 750g maize meal
For the Beef Stew: 50ml sunflower oil, 1.5kg beef cubes, 200g onions, 10g garlic, 100g Knorr Tomato Pronto, 2L water, 350g potatoes, 100g carrots, 40g Knorr Brown Sauce Gravy Base

For the Chakalaka: 70ml sunflower oil, 180g onions, 7g garlic, 3g Rajah Medium Curry Powder, 55g green pepper, 220g carrots, 125g cabbage, 125g Knorr Tomato Pronto, 10g Robertsons Veggie Seasoning, 5g Knorr Aromat Original, 220g baked beans, 2g red chillies
For the Beetroot and Apple Salad: 70g onions, 1kg cooked beetroot, 125g chutney, 325g grated apple

For the Potato Salad: 250g fried bacon, 1kg boiled pears, 100g red onion, 50g pickled jalapenos, 15g chives, 100g grated cheddar cheese, 200g Hellmann's Tangy Mayonnaise, 200g Hellmann's Creamy Ranch Salad Dressing
For the Peri-Peri Spinach: 60g margarine, 120g onions, 5g garlic, 20g Knorr Peri-Peri Marinade, 540g Knorr Tomato Pronto, 400g blanched spinach, 500ml fresh cream
For the Roasted Butternut: 1.5kg butternut, 20g Robertsons Veggie Seasoning, 50g margarine
instructions: Prepare Pap: Combine maize meal and boiling water, cook over low heat.
Beef Stew: Brown beef, add onions, garlic, tomato, and water. Simmer and add vegetables and gravy base.
Chakalaka: Fry onions, garlic, curry powder, add remaining ingredients, and simmer.
Beetroot and Apple Salad: Combine all ingredients.
Potato Salad: Mix all ingredients.
Peri-Peri Spinach: Sauté onions, add spices, tomato sauce, spinach, and cream.
Roasted Butternut: Roast butternut with seasoning and margarine.

recipes.name: Braised Beef Short Ribs
instructions: Preheat oven to 180C.
Season and flour ribs, brown in oil.
Sauté onions, carrots, and garlic, add tomato paste and wine.
Add meat back in, potatoes, thyme, and beef stock.
Cover and cook for 2.5 hours.

recipes.name: Cheesy Zucchini and Pasta Slice
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C/160°C fan-forced. Grease a 20cm x 30cm lamington pan. Line base and sides with baking paper, extending paper 2cm above edge on both sides.
Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling, salted water following packet directions until tender. Drain. Rinse under cold water. Drain.

Using hands, squeeze excess liquid from zucchini. Combine pasta, zucchini, onion, ham, cheese, corn and flour in a bowl. Add egg, oil and milk. Season with salt and pepper. Mix well to combine. Spread mixture into prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden and just set. Stand for 15 minutes. Serve.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Bolognese Cups
ingredients: 1/2 cup roughly chopped fresh basil leaves
1/4 cup roughly chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
instructions: Cook spaghetti following packet directions until tender.

Meanwhile, heat oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until just softened. Add mince. Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon to break up lumps, for 5 to 6 minutes or until browned. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add tomato purée. Simmer for 10 minutes until thickened.
Preheat oven to 180C/160C fan-forced. Grease 18 holes of two muffin pans.
Mix mince mixture with spaghetti, eggs, flour, half the cheese, basil, and parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Divide mixture into muffin pans, compacting it. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is golden.

recipes.name: Lamb Chops with Rosemary Gravy
instructions: Mix Marinade ingredients and marinate lamb for at least 1 hour.
Heat a large skillet over high heat. Cook lamb chops 4 minutes per side for medium rare. Remove from skillet and rest.
For the gravy, add flour to the skillet and cook for 30 seconds. Gradually add beef stock, stirring until thickened. Add rosemary and simmer.

recipes.name: Asparagus and Ham Filo Pie with Salsa Verde
instructions: Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced. Layer filo pastry in a slice pan.
Whisk eggs and milk. Arrange ham, tomatoes, asparagus, spinach, peas, and ricotta in pan. Pour over egg mixture. Bake for 25-30 minutes.
For salsa verde, mix basil, mint, olive oil, lemon juice, and garlic.

recipes.name: Brown Rice and Salmon Patties
ingredients: 2 tbsp finely chopped fresh coriander leaves
instructions: Cook rice. Cool.
Sauté onion and garlic. Add to rice with salmon, coriander, cheese, beans, flour, egg, and kecap manis.
Form patties. Chill.
Cook patties for 2 minutes each side until golden. Serve with vegetables and yoghurt dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Best-Ever Homemade Sausage Rolls
ingredients: 1/4 cup finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
instructions: Preheat oven to 220C. Thaw pastry. Mix meat filling.
Shape filling into sausage shapes and roll in pastry.
Cut and bake rolls for 25-30 minutes until golden.
